1.Text:
An old fortress, the headquarters of the Shadow
Garden. There, recruits endure harsh training
under Lambda's strict gaze.

A young woman who only just joined the Garden, given
the name Number 666, is one such traineeâ€”
Haaahhh!!!
...Pathetic. Hmph!
Ugh! *huff, huff*

I'm here training you myself, and this is the best
you can do? You lack both skill and passion.
Do you even want to be here?
Yes! I do!

Then focus! You think you can beat me with your mind
on everything but your swordplay?!

Well you can't! I won't waste my time on someone who
can't even keep her attention on her own training!
I'm sorry! Please, just give me a little longer!

...No, we're through. There's no merit or sense in
me ninstructing you as you are now.
But...!

What's the point if nothing changes? I know I don't
have any breath to waste on soldiers who don't
show a shred of promise!

If you understand, then go run laps. At least that
should do you some good.
...Understood.

Choking down her frustration and shame, Number 666
sets down her weapon and goes to run as ordered.
*huff, huff*
(What am I doing? This isn't what I came here for...)

(No, this is all because of how pathetic I am. I'm
weak, and that's no one's fault but my own...)
(On the day I made my decision, I was still...)

Perhaps I'll return to the capital, meet with the
factions opposed to Perv...
You have two choices.
Huh?!
Ch-Choices...?

You can fight alone...or you can fight alongside us,
the Shadow Garden. But you have to choose.
Can you...save the Kingdom of Oriana?

Right now, we have no reason to act on your behalf.
If you want to save your country, show us your worth.
Worth...?
Yours, and that of the Kingdom of Oriana.
...Can you truly save my kingdom?
That depends upon you.

...Is Slayerâ€”no, Shadowâ€”the leader of your
organization?
...He is.
...Forgive me, Father.
...Then my blade is yours.

(...That's right. I came here because I was set on
saving Oriana.)

(And yet, nothing is going as I'd hoped... I'm losing
time while gaining nothing in return.)
(If this continues, then Oriana is doomed...)

Number 666 is suddenly overcome by a powerful wave
of uncertainty and panic.

(I can't keep going on like this. I have to do
something...)

(But...what exactly is it that I'm supposed to do?
I know I need to get stronger...)

(But how can I do that when I'm not even sure where
to start...? I'm at a complete loss.)

Beset by confusion and worry, all Number 666 can do
is run until the sun sets, the answers still eluding her.

2.Text:
It is night, and a lone figure stands on the training
ground, swinging her sword intentlyâ€”Number 666.

(I should be exhausted, but I'm much too anxious to
sleep...)

(The only thing that can calm me in this state is
pushing myself past my limits.)

(I'll swing my sword just a little more and become
that tiny bit stronger. There is so much I still lack,
but even the smallest effort ought to make some
positive change.)
Ha! Yaah!

I thought someone was making an awful racket and look
who I find...Number 666.
Instructor Lambda?! My apologies, I'll leave at once!

Before you do, let me ask you something. Where did
you learn those sword techniques?
Hah!

I'm mimicking a style of swordplay that I admire.
Drawing upon a childhood memory that was
burned into my mind.
A style of swordplay you admire, huh... I see.

(A style that combines both power and grace...much
like that of Master Shadow and Lady Alpha.)

(I don't know why someone like her, who only just
joined the Garden, would be familiar with their
techniques...)

(Still, this is a far cry from their brilliance.
Even for simple imitation, it's much too
crude.)
Um... Am I doing something wrong?

...No, it's nothing. I've changed my mind. I'm going
to offer you a test.
Y-Yes, ma'am! Thank you so much!
Now...cut that boulder over there.
Lambda points to a large boulder.
Cut it...? Is that all?

Anyone could cut the boulders around here if they
infuse a little magic into their sword...
Spare me. Just show me you can do it.
Understood. Now then...haaa!!!

Number 666 fills her sword with magic and swings it at
the boulder, causing it to break part with a clatter.
...Phew. Instructor Lambda, as you asked, Iâ€”

As I asked? Do you not even know the difference
between "cut" and "shatter"?
Wh-What do you mean...?

Allow me to demonstrate. This is what I mean
by "cut"!

Lambda unleashes a magic-infused strike toward one of
the boulders, cleanly bisecting it without breaking
apart. The stone had quite literally been cut.
A-Amazing... You sliced it so cleanly...!

I wouldn't be so happy. Because I expect you to do
this too.

You've got one week. Make sure you can cut a boulder
by then.

But I want you back here for practice tomorrow.
Think of rest as another skill to master.
Yes, ma'am! Thank you!

(This is not some unreasonable task... No, I've been
given a chance.)

(I've been blundering along, unsure of what to do,
but this could very well show me the way forward.)
(...I'll prove I can do it, no matter what!)

3.Text:
Lambda had given Number 666 a task. But try as she
might to cleave a boulder in two within the week she
had been givenâ€”
Haaah!!!
...Another failure. All I'm doing is smashing them.

(It's been four days...and I haven't made any
progress. I knew it wouldn't be easy, but I
never thought I'd struggle this much.)
What is it I'm missing here...

(I have to become stronger... If I don't, then I'll
lose even more, face even more heartbreak.)

(...But how do I do that? What is it I need to do?
I don't even know what it is that I lack...)

(...No. I can't lose myself to uncertainty and fear
again. At times like these, I just need to stay calm.)
Whew...

(Maybe it's a sign of how weak-hearted I am that
I get upset so easily.)

(...I need to rethink this with a calm head and heart.
Why am I failing to cut the boulder, and what can I
do to change that.)
The swordplay I seek is...

Number 666 turns her mind to a memory from the past,
to the graceful swordsmanship she witnessed amidst
the terror and confusion of that day.

(What I saw that day was much more refined and
precise, yet also free of excess.)

(The person I'd aspired to for so long..he bestowed
me with power, but I haven't been able to put it to
any use at all... What is it that makes he and I so
different...)

"Do not forget. True strength does not come from
power, but from within you."
...True strength?

(That's right... The way he swung his sword, it wasn't
with magic-infused brute force, but...)
And then, the day arrives.

It's been a week. Judging by your face, I take it
you've had a breakthrough.
Now, Number 666! Show me what you've learned!
Yes, ma'am!
Magic slowly flows into Rose's sword.

(Her magic is calm, not rough like before. Looks like
she really has figured something out.)
...Yaaah!!!

With a yell, Number 666 cleaves the boulder in two
with her blade.
...Phew. How was that?

...Not quite perfect. You spent too much time
preparing, which isn't practical.

But...it's a world of difference from that sloppy
display you put on last time. Good work.
*gasp* Thank you!

So, Number 666, did you realize anything while
practicing?

Well...I compared the beautiful swordsmanship I saw
in the past with my own here in the present.

I suppose my abilities are approaching what I saw
that day. That...perhaps they are no longer a
mockery, a pale imitation.

As I thought back on that memory, I realized that his
movements were graceful and subtle, not brash and
emotional like mine.

It's not amassing huge amounts of magic that
matters... Until now I was too focused on what
I was missing, to the point that I failed to see
how futile that was.

("True strength does not come from power, but from
within you." I think I understand those words a little
better now. You saved me yet again...)

...Correct. Magic is not a blunt instrument where the
more you pile on, the better. You need to be able to
wield it properly.
Never forget that.
Yes, ma'am!

(This is the first time I've felt results since
coming to the Shadow Garden.)

(If I keep this up, I will become stronger! Then, one
day, I can save my homeland...)

4.Text:
Having completed Lambda's task and grasping how to
manipulate magic, Number 666 gradually begins to
stand out from the other trainees.

(I managed to keep up again today... I'm improving,
bit by bit.)

(I need to prove myself, and quickly. That will open
the way for me.)

(...Time is of the essence. I must get them to
recognize my skills as quickly as I can, before
Oriana is completely lost...)
Hey, Number 666. Clean out your ears!
Y-Yes, ma'am! How can I serve?!

You've been looking pretty good out there lately.
Maybe you're finding it so easy you think it's okay
to daydream?
N-No, ma'am, I'm sorry...

I have something special planned for you tomorrow.
Be ready.
Th-Thank you! May as I ask what it is...?

Simple. You'll be facing someone more skilled than
usual. And you better believe you won't have any
time for stray thoughts!
Yes, ma'am! I'll be prepared!

The next day, Number 666 is set to spar with an
opponent hand-picked for her by Lambda.

Neither excited nor apprehensive, she merely waits
quietly for the moment to arrive.

Now, let us commence Number 666's special training.
...Nu!
Yes, I'm here.
(But when did she get here...?! So she's Nu...)

Go a round with 666 here. And no mercy or going easy
just because you're both humans.

Understood... I look forward to facing you today,
Number 666.
Likewise, thank you for the opportunity!
And thus Number 666's special lesson begins...
Heh...!
...Urgh!

(I knew she would be strong...but to this extent!
This fight couldn't be more one-sided...)

(Nevertheless, my own swordplay and magic aren't too
inferior to hers. I can still win if I can just find an opening
to exploit!)

(Besides, I have a reason not to lose! I must take
back the Kingdom of Oriana!)
Haaah!!!
...Weak.

With a flash of her blade, Nu causes Number 666
to lose her form.
The tip of Nu's sword points at Rose's throat.
...Your loss.
Enough!
Wait, please! Let us go another round...!
I don't mind, but...
...Keep at it 'til you're satisfied.

Number 666 proceeded to challenge Nu until she had no
more strength in her, but in the end she lost every
round.
Urgh...! I lost...utterly and completely...
(She doesn't even look flushed...)
Thank you, Nu. As for you, Number 666...
Y-Yes, ma'am!
Why did you join the Shadow Garden?

I thought I told you to throw everything away!
So tell me, just what have you rid yourself of?!

We are all here because we have staked everything on
our fight! If you think this is some game, then get out of
my sight, now!
Ahh...

Number 666 is filled with chagrin, but she has no
words to say in the face of such a pitiful outcome.

5.Text: ...It's so quiet. No after-hours training tonight?

No, not tonight. Wait, I hope it hasn't been
disturbing you...

That's not what I meant. I'd been hearing someone
practicing their swordplay these past few days, so I
was simply curious.

I see. That must have been Number 666. I told her
that rest is also a skill to master, but...

Well, putting in hard work isn't a bad thing. So what
do you think of her?

Well... She stands out from the others in terms of
character and ability. A little more discipline and
she'll make for a useful pawn.

You call her a "pawn", but she certainly seems to
have caught your attention.

That's not how I intended it, but...as her instructor,
I can't help but do so.
Heehee, such a serious answer.

But it's not just her. Each of our recruits has been
assigned duties suited to their personalities and
talents. All of this is thanks to your guidance.

True kindness masked by stern words and actionsâ€”
perhaps this is what draws others to your lead, hm?
That...is only because I lack experience.
I rely on you greatly as you are now.

That's why I want you to do things as you see fit.
If that doesn't get us results, then we can return
to the drawing board.

Lady Alpha, I... Thank you. I shall continue to
perform my duties as instructor to the best of
my ability.

Elsewhere, Number 666 is still dejected after her
training session.
Why did you join the Shadow Garden?

I thought I told you to throw everything away!
So tell me, just what have you rid yourself of?!

We are all here because we have staked everything on
our fight! If you think this is some game, then get out of
my sight, now!
I cast away so much in coming here...

It wasn't supposed to be like this. I didn't come
here in search of frustration...
When, where...how did I go wrong?

...You didn't do anything wrong. You just haven't
cast everything aside yet.
N-Nu...?! When did you...?

I've been here the entire time. Looks like you were
too downcast to notice.

Oh...I see... What do you mean that I haven't cast
everything aside?

I mean your former self, Rose Oriana. It appears that
she's very much still with you.
That's not true! On that day, I became Number 666!
Then why are you so panicked and confused?
Huh...?

If you truly had nothing to compare to your current
reality, you'd never face that kind of doubt.
What?! But...

Possession was like the death of our previous selves.
We were then reborn with new names and a new
purpose. That is the Shadow Garden.

But you're different. You intend to become Rose again
if everything goes as you hope. Am I wrong?
*gasp*

It's that attachment that causes me to see both Rose
and Number 666 in you now.
If you wish to remain here, Number 666...

Then your former self, Rose Oriana, needs to die.
By your own hand.
I must kill my former self...

Memories, both good and bad, the future that lay
ahead for youâ€”the more of Rose you cast aside,
the closer you will become to being a blade of the
Shadow Garden.

That is how everyone here attained strength. We let
go of the past so that we might move ever forward in
battle.

This is a very painful choice, but the rewards are
equally great. Now...which do you choose?

6.Text: ...Good morning, Instructor Lambda.
...You're still here? I thought I told you to leave.
I'm here today...to ask a favor of you.

Heh, as if I need to listen to anything a weakling
like you has to say!

I am not a weakling! I prepared myself for the worst
in coming here today!
...Hmph.

(This isn't all talk. I don't know what happened, but
there's definitely something different about her.)
Very well, speak.
Thank you. Please...train me once more.

It can be fundamental drills, or sparring...anything.
I don't mind, just please, allow me to be a member
of the Shadow Garden!

You don't have what it takes, and that won't change
no matter how many times we go through this. Before
long you'll falter and end up back in the dirt again.

Yes, I know I lost before... But thanks to that I now
recognize my weakness!

I'm not trying to deny my previous faults. In fact,
it's because I admit them that I'm here now!

My defeats and my former identity...they will all be
steps on the path to my becoming a blade of the
Shadow Garden!
...Well, well.

(Hmm, so she's wisened up to her own failings. And it
looks like she's ready to really let go of her past.
All that's left...is for me to make sure of things
myself.)
...Fine.
*gasp*
Only this time it won't be Nu you face...it'll be me.

This is your last chance, are we clear? Fail to prove
your worth to me here and... Well, I think you know
the rest.
...I'm ready!

Alright then...let the training begin! Give me
everything you've got!!!

7.Text: C'mon! You won't win with defense alone!
...Urgh! I know that!

(It looks like she's stuck on the defensive, but this
is different than before... Her eyes tell me she's
focused on the battle, waiting for her chance.)
(This time, you just might have it...)
You're leaving yourself way too open, maggot!
C'mon, come at me like you want me dead!
My magic control...is ready!
Haaah!!!
Lambda is knocked back by Number 666.

She can see that the girl's sword is filled with just
the right amount of magic for its form.

So you were fending me off while focusing on your
magic control, huh. Not bad.
I'm just getting started...!

(That was just me putting the things I've learned
thus far into practice. Overcoming what comes next
will be the real challenge!)

(Cast aside Rose Oriana! Cast aside all those happy
memories, the sad ones, the future that awaited her!)

(Cast aside Alexia and Natsume, those she swore to
fight alongside! Cast aside the father who raised her
with such care! And...)

(Cast aside Cid, the first and surely last person she
will ever love!)

(All you memories I couldn't bring myself to be rid
of until the very end... I am doing away with Rose so
I can become Number 666. And that is why...)
...I bid you farewell.

Number 666's slime sword transforms, as responding to her
words.

Her slime sword is responding to her magic?!
Its blade is growing thin and pointed, like aâ€”
...Haah!!!
Urk!

Number 666's sword moves with much more speed and
force than Lambda anticipated, crushing her defenses.
Urgh!
Now!

With Lambda off balance, Number 666 moves to deliver
a powerful blow. But Lambda produces a slime sword of
her own to intercept Rose.
Wha...?! I was so close!
You had me for a second there!

But I'm not just an instructor in title alone!
I'll take everything you can throw at me
and return it tenfold!
I'm not done... Not by a long shot!

Number 666 swings her sword with increasing vigor,
driving Lambda back.
(Come on, sword...hit! Hit...! HIT!!!)
Haaaaaaahhhhh!!!
Yaaaaaaah!!!

The refined magic clashes together, bathing the area
in blinding light.
Did I...get her?
What...happened?

...She lost consciousness the moment she let off that
last attack.

Her body had probably already reached its limit and
was moving off pure adrenaline. Too bad, she might
have landed a hit if she'd able to last a bit longer.

That's why I told her...rest is another skill to
master.
Still...well done.

She showed a lot of improvement. More than I
had anticipated...

Hmph, only because she was so awful before. I'd say
she only just now became worth even acknowledging.

Her stamina and skills still need a lot of work.
Send her out into the field as she is now and
she's a goner. That's why I'll begin training
her tomorrow.

So does that mean...you accept her as a member
of the Shadow Garden?
Hmph! Just get that unconscious idiot inside.
Yes, ma'am, as you wish.

Hmph... This is the first time a recruit has ever
given me such a headache.
(My eyes won't open... Guess I really overdid it.)
(Goodbye, Rose Oriana...the old me.)
(Does this mean...I've been reborn?)
(Was I able to prove my strength...?)
Oh hey, Nu. Why're you carrying Rose?

Ah, it's rare to see you back at the Garden, my lord.
She just finished training with Lambda.

Man, she looks really banged up. Hope Lambda didn't
go too hard on her. Ah well, I've gotten carried away
too, so I guess it happens.
Anyways, good work, guys.

(I swore that I was going to forget...but I can still
recall your voice even now.)
(You at least...I want to remember always...)
